niagara.ndom.saxdom
Class Page

java.lang.Object
  niagara.ndom.saxdom.Page

public class Page
extends java.lang.Object

Page data describe a sequence of SAX events, using three parallel arrays: an array of bytes, describing the type of each event, an array of (pointers to) String objects, and an array of pointers to each event's next sibling. SAXDOM documents contain a sequence of pages. Pages are linked together in a doubly-linked list. Pages are reference counted. Documents that use them pin and unpin them in memory.

loadEvents

public int loadEvents(int offset,
                      int length,
                      byte[] types,
                      short[] string_indexes,
                      java.lang.String[] strings,
                      int[] openNodes,
                      SAXDOMReader sr)
               throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Bulk load events until we encounter END_DOCUMENT, reach the end of the page, or the end of the input buffers

Returns:
the offset for the END_DOCUMENT if we encountered one, the length of the page if we've reached it without finding END_DOCUMENT, or -1 if we've reached the end of the input buffers before document end.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException
